node.title: Linda McAlister, Philosopher and Founder of Feminist Journal, Dies at 82
node.description: She was among a collective of philosophy professors who started Hypatia, the first major scholarly publication to view the discipline from a feminist lens.

node.title: Ukraine Says Troop Call Up is Defensive Maneuver Over Concerns Russian Planning Invasion
node.description: Ukraine's defense minister denied any accusations that Ukraine plans to attack anyone, saying the troop buildup is a defense against Russia's troop buildup.

node.title: CEOs of DoorDash, Pinterest Join Giving Pledge, Say They'll Donate Over Half Their Fortunes
node.description: The Giving Pledge announced that another 14 billionaires would be signing the pledge to donate more than half of their wealth to charitable organizations.

node.title: The Cutest TikTok Unboxing of the Year Involves 4 Paws
node.description: An adorable kitten unboxing video is delighting fans on TikTik with 1 million views this holiday season.

node.title: Americans Who Identify With No Religion Now Account for 29 Percent of Population: Poll
node.description: The diversity in age, location, and race among those unaffiliated with religion is growing across the country.

node.title: Tornado Alley may be shifting east, threatening businesses and supply chains
node.description: Violent storms struck a growing manufacturing and supply-chain hub, causing an estimated $18 billion in economic damage.

node.title: The U.S. Air Force dismisses 27 members over vaccine refusals.
node.description: They are the first members of a total military force of more than two million believed to be forced out over the shots.

node.title: Governments Are 'Overreacting' to Omicron Says Angelique Coetzee, Scientist Who Helped Identify It
node.description: The medic criticized restrictions in response to Omicron, but her comments have been dismissed as "the most dangerous kind of message" and "utter rubbish".

node.title: Video Released of Suspect in Death of Billionaire Who Mused Rival Might Want to Kill Him
node.description: The suspect in the video is described as wearing a hat and kicking up their right boot when they walk. The man or woman is estimated to be 5-foot-6 to 5-foot-9.

node.title: Oxford Shooting 'Copycat' Threats Prompt Calls for Michigan Schools to Go Virtual Into 2022
node.description: More than 10,700 people have signed a petition calling on schools to move online until after the winter break.

node.title: D.C. AG Karl Racine Sues Proud Boys, Oath Keepers Over January 6 Riot
node.description: "Today, we're holding these insurrectionists accountable," Racine said.

node.title: Proud Boys and Oath Keepers sued over January 6 attack
node.description: Using a law that had been used to go after the Ku Klux Klan, the civil lawsuit will try to obtain financial relief from the groups.

node.title: A look at the decline of jobs that supported middle class life
node.description: Work at all of Kellogg Co.'s U.S. cereal plants​ came to a halt in October after workers went on strike.

node.title: 'Impossible' Abstract Reasoning Assessment in Job Application Sparks Fury
node.description: The test asked candidates to decide the next shape in the pattern, but many online were left struggling and questioned exactly how useful it is.

node.title: Florida Company to Give Away 2 Mortgage-Free Homes to Employees in Random Drawing
node.description: To qualify for the drawing, employees must be with the company for a full year, complete 20 hours of community service and take a financial literacy class.

node.title: Biden Travel Ban Gains Less Support From Americans Than Trump's China Restrictions: Polls
node.description: At the start of the pandemic, more than 90 percent of Americans polled said it was necessary to shut down international travel.

node.title: Chinese tech giant Alibaba fires employee who claimed sexual assault
node.description: The employee, identified only as Ms. Zhou, went public in August with allegations that she was raped by a colleague on a business trip.

node.title: "Doomsday glacier" ice shelf could shatter within 5 years, scientists say
node.description: Researchers said the entire glacier holds enough water to raise sea levels by more than two feet.

node.title: Kentucky on My Mind
node.description: On states that bite the hand that feeds them.

node.title: People Scoop Spilled Gas to Use at Home Following Truck Explosion That Killed Over 50
node.description: This is the latest in a string of nationwide hardships, including a fuel shortage, 7.2 magnitude earthquake, and a presidential assassination--all in 2021.

node.title: 9 Years After Sandy Hook, Oxford Shooting Sees Parents Prosecuted in Unprecedented Move
node.description: The charges against Ethan Crumbley's parents "is a major marker that may provide an example to other prosecutors," Michael McAuliffe told Newsweek.

node.title: Some Kroger Employees Without COVID Vaccine to Pay $50 a Month Surcharge On Health Plan
node.description: Kroger said that unvaccinated managers and non-union workers on the company health care plan will pay a $50 monthly surcharge starting January 1.

node.title: Instacart Driver Accused of Running Over Groceries After Seeing Customers' Pro-Police Sign
node.description: According to a police statement, the driver has been identified and will likely face charges "in the near future."

node.title: Internet Divided Over Redditor 'Not Respecting' Boyfriend's Religious Mom's Rules
node.description: The woman said she was surprised when her boyfriend's mother would not let them sleep in the same room despite them living together abroad.

node.title: Ex-NFL player who killed 6 people had CTE, autopsy finds
node.description: Authorities say former NFL player Phillip Adams fatally shot six people in South Carolina before killing himself in April.

node.title: Famed for Fiction, Jim Harrison Was Also a Poet of Prodigious Appetites
node.description: Pleasure and mortality are the twin themes of Harrison’s mammoth “Complete Poems,” spanning his career from his 1965 debut to his 2016 death.

node.title: Top 10 New York Dishes of 2021
node.description: As restaurants began to emerge from pandemic lockdowns, Pete Wells was often drawn to superlative versions of classic dishes.

node.title: New York’s Top 10 New Restaurants of 2021
node.description: After a year that began with indoor dining banned in the city, our critic Pete Wells cherishes the places that celebrate sharing — and life.

node.title: ‘The Royal Tenenbaums’ at 20: When Wes Anderson Imagined New York
node.description: The film’s vision of the city is at once entirely made up and very real seeming, both dated and contemporary. But the movie couldn’t outrun current events.

node.title: South Africa Data Shows Omicron Can Evade COVID Vaccine, Shots Prevent Hospitalization
node.description: People who received two shots of the Pfizer vaccine had 33 percent protection against becoming infected with the variant, according to an analysis.
